runs.comm: length ball, on the line of off, whipped to leg with a flourish by Shahzad but straight to midwicket
back of a length outside off, seams away a touch and the batsman swishes and misses
pitched up, angled in towards off stump, turned through leg for one to get off the mark
lifts off a good length and comes back in at Mangal, who stays back deflects the ball past his stumps to long leg
length ball, high backlift from Shahzad and driven into the ground to mid-on, Patel gets across and but misfields as Mangal is sent back
quick and straight and slapped high into the night sky - Broad is underneath it at mid-off and Shahzad fails to achieve lift off this time.

that's two in two, another sorry slog up and down and out! It was a length ball outside off, kicked a bit off the surface and Shafiqullah, facing his first ball, swings cross-batted, can't get over it and Ravi Bopara, the sub fielder, takes another steepling catch at cover before falling on his front
is that three in a row? No, there was no glove - only helmet - as Dernbach bounced Sadiq first ball, the ball banging into protective gear and looping to slip
fences and misses outside off, another quick length ball that fizzes through
dug in short and he's in position this time, hooking in front of square for a couple
length ball, in the corridor, beats Sadiq for pace as he tries to hit the cover off it
slower ball this time, wide of the stumps, Sadiq has to wait for it to arrive and can then only pat to point
slings this down the leg side - that'll be wide
defended down into the ground in front of the stumps, Mangal keeps an eye on it to make sure he doesn't go the same way as Kieswetter (seems a long time ago, that)
length ball, pushed into the off side
quick and straight in the channel outside off, punched into the covers again
pitched up and Mangal-ed wide of mid-on, it was in the air but Patel was labouring to get to his right and the ball skips away for four
short ball, at the man as Mangal walks across, misses with a swipe but it was straight enough not to be called wide
another bumper, tries to pull and Finn appeals for a glove down the leg side - umpire Taufel signals wide instead, much to Finn's chagrin
pitched up outside off, solid forward block towards cover
length ball, rises off the pitch and squirts to long leg as the bat turns in Mangals hands
pitched up outside off, punched through a gap at cover for a couple

that's a superb catch and Mangal has to go! The ball was short, came quickly on to the bat as Mangal tried to hook, it was ungainly, went straight back towards the bowler and Broad reached to his right in his follow-through and plucked it out of the air as he tumbled to the ground
touch short again, shuffles across and flicks through backward square from outside off
leg side bumper, tries to pull and wears the ball flush on the groin [winces]
length ball outside off, beats the outside edge as Stanikzai plays from the crease
back of a length, turned off the pads through square leg
pitched up outside off, big, free swing of the bat and sliced to third man
dug in, at the man, backs away and is hit on the body
length ball on the line of off, nicely played by Sadiq, back foot in the air as he whips through midwicket for a couple
screwed high off the edge, trying to lump a length ball down the ground, it bounces and spins as Bairstow runs around and he does fell to avoid embarrassment and pat it back into play
on the stumps, coming back in, can't get the drive away
length ball, angled towards leg stump, Stanikzai goes back and is hit on the pad, the ball popping towards gully for a leg bye
back of a length outside off, tires to pull and bottom-edges on to the pitch
on the stumps, takes the pace off, defended

full, yorker length, chopped straight to square leg ... and this is going to be a run-out, Sadiq yards out of his ground and gawping as Broad breaks the wicket! Smart work from Buttler, he dived to his left, reined the ball in with Sadiq already charging down the pitch, tossed it straight to the bowler to complete a rather village dismissal as Stanikzai watched forlornly from the safety of his crease

another one gone, what a catch from Bairstow! Broad bounced Stanikzai again, the bombardment has been almost relentless, and he got under an awkward hook shot, the ball looping towards long leg ... where it looked as if Bairstow's dive would come up just short but he got his hands underneath it and almost ended up doing a headstand as he completed an extraordinary take!
slightly short, at the wicket, defended on the back foot
bouncer, over the head of Nabi as he flinches out of the way
tossed up on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
flighted outside the line of off, pushed through the covers
pushed through on off stump, tapped straight to cover
angled in with the arm towards the stumps, prodded back to the bowler
on the stumps, solid defensive block into the off side
tossed up and driven wide of cover, this time they get one
flighted, spinning in from outside off, turned to midwicket
tossed up and tickled back to the bowler
this goes straight on outside off, bit of flight and dip and beats the outside edge

tries to break the shackles with a reverse sweep and picks out the fielder at deep backward point! Shenwari got height but not enough to clear Finn and Afghanistan are six down and in record defeat territory
spins back across sharply and rolls away off the pad
turned to midwicket from the crease
on the stumps, played back to Patel
tossed up and worked into the leg side
bowled him, seven down! Patel tossed it up, Nabi advanced, played outside the line and turned to see his leg stump pegged back
tossed up and gets behind it in defence
flighted on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
advances, windmills the bat and stumped, another gone! This is a bloodbath, Afghanistan's batsmen swinging wildly from the hip and being picked off - two in the over for Patel
tossed up on the stumps, played back to the bowler
length ball, spinning in, chopped to cover on the back foot
flighted outside off, edged to short third man
spinning in, beats the forward prod and somehow misses the stumps on its way through
floated up outside off, defended on the front foot
plays back and chops to cover - another maiden for Swann
tossed up and turned into the leg side
flighted outside off, tries to cut, miscues back down the pitch
tossed up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
touch short, outside off and heaved with a horizontal bat through midwicket, Buttler slides and stops, though they check to see if his foot touched the rope - it didn't
floated up outside off, defended on the front foot
gets outside the line and presses forward in defence
tossed up outside off and chipped back over Swann's head for a straight four - only the second of the innings
leans out and hoicks high into the outfield, between long-on and deep midwicket for another boundary
flighted outside off, dabbed towards cover
pushed through, swatted through square leg and the fielders converge on it in the deep
defended in front of the stumps
waheeeeeeeeyyyy, here we go, Gulbodin plants the front foot and thwacks Swann back over wide long-on
length ball outside off, beats the bat as Zadran pokes uncertainly
short ball, the batsman backs off and fences blindly
another ungainly avoidance manoeuvre from the tailender, as a bumper zips by at chest height
short and outside off, sways back and drops the hands - that's better
fired down the leg side - another to the total
length ball on the stumps, patted into the off side
back of a length, Zadran defends into the off side on the back foot
pitched up outside off, smears the ball straight to extra-cover
dug in, Gulbodin takes on the bouncer and tennis-smashes to long-on ... he then turns down the single. Still wants to protect the tail, does Gulbodin
another bouncer, misses with an airy swipe
length ball outside off, sliced over the slips and that'll run away for four as Broad puffs out his cheeks
heaves hard again, this goes loops high over mid-off and this time the batsman is happy to take the single
short and at the man, calmly defended on the back foot
slower ball, big ole swing, edged to long leg and again he turns down one
steps away and scoops into the air, off the toe of the bat - but it lands short of Bairstow coming in from long-on
back of a length, steered towards third man to get off the strike
slower ball, outside off, completely dupes Gulbodin who had wound up for the big one and nearly fell over as he stepped outside leg to wait for it
pitched up outside off and smacked dismissively back over long-off for six! Now, if only they hadn't lost those eight early wickets...
short ball, wide of off, steps back and crunched< over deep midwicket, that's gone a long way
round the wicket, defended back to the bowler
shot! Zadran goes down on one knee and carves a mighty mow over deep midwicket for six more
and got him, slides on with the arm, inside the line of the bat and Dharmasena raises the finger, Zadran sloping off one run shy of double figures
over the wicket, spinning back from outside off and blocked
tossed up and defended back down the track
length ball, tapped to cover
short ball, swatted out towards wide long-on, a vicious kick off the turf takes the ball past Bairstow's nose and over the rope for four
full length ball outside off, swings like a rusty gate and misses
full bunger at the stumps, clubbed straight back down the ground to long-on, doesn't take a single - he's just having some batting practice, is Gulbodin
bounced, wide of the stumps ... but too high
takes the pace off this time, Gulbodin swings and misses
Finn to Gulbodin Naib, 1 run, full length and wide of the stumps, Gulbodin edges across and plays an outrageous scoop for four to deep backward square
full and wide and slapped into the covers and it gets Gulbodin to the striker's end for the next over
rolled out the back of the hand, punched to long-off, turned down one

and that's it, Dernbach gets the final wicket as Gulbodin slogs into the air off the toe of the bat, falling tragically short of a defiant half-century - still, he has bettered his previous T20I best by 27 runs and recorded the highest score by a No. 8 in the format. Silver linings aside, that means England win by 116 runs
